column4: hi, if I copy some files via a cp -rvp /myFiles* /destination, how can I see the Mbit/s of this copy command? is there a tool I can pipe the command through?
pv can measure the data through a pipe. but you will have to use a more convoluted command
thank you I look through the man page, thx mlissner and jrib too
something like tar cpf - /myFiles* | pv | tar xf - -C /destination
